      • canConvertToLambda

        public static boolean canConvertToLambda(PsiMethodReferenceExpression referenceExpression)

      • createLambda

        public static PsiLambdaExpression createLambda(PsiMethodReferenceExpression referenceExpression,
                                               boolean doNotAddParameterTypes)
        Convert method reference to lambda if possible and return the created lambda without replacing original method reference.
        Parameters:
        referenceExpression - a method reference to convert
        doNotAddParameterTypes - if false, parameter types could be added to the lambda to resolve ambiguity
        Returns:
        a created lambda or null if conversion fails

      • simplifyToExpressionLambda

        public static void simplifyToExpressionLambda(PsiLambdaExpression lambdaExpression)

      • removeSideEffectsFromLambdaBody

        public static void removeSideEffectsFromLambdaBody(Editor editor,
                                                   PsiLambdaExpression lambdaExpression)
        Works for expression lambdas/one statement code block lambdas to ensures equivalent method ref -> lambda transformation.

      • canConvertToLambdaWithoutSideEffects

        public static boolean canConvertToLambdaWithoutSideEffects(PsiMethodReferenceExpression methodReferenceExpression)
        Checks whether method reference can be converted to lambda without significant semantics change (i.e. method reference qualifier has no side effects)
        Parameters:
        methodReferenceExpression - method reference to check
        Returns:
        true if method reference can be converted to lambda
